Race.SpecificTitle: PW School District -- Local Option - Term Limits
Race.FullText:
"LOCAL OPTION ELECTION
Within Terrebonne Parish School District:
Shall the number of terms of office that any member of the school board may serve be limited to three consecutive four-year terms?"

Race.SpecificTitle: PW Parish Council -- 1.66 Mills - PC - 11 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Parishwide Proposition
(Property Tax Extension and Rededication)

Summary:  Authority to extend for a term of 11 years, and rededicate the proceeds of a 1.66 mills property tax for acquiring, constructing, operating and maintaining the Terrebonne Parish Health Unit and health unit facilities.
Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of Terrebonne, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), levy and collect the special tax of one and sixty-six hundredths (1.66) mills on all property subject to taxation in the Parish (the "Tax") (an estimated $1,275,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for an additional eleven (11) years, beginning with the year 2020 and ending with the year 2030, the Tax being presently authorized to be levied and collected through the year 2019, for Public Health Unit purposes by an election held in the Parish on November 4, 2008, and shall the revenues or proceeds of the Tax heretofore or hereafter received from both the original and extended authorizations of the levy and collection of the Tax be dedicated and used for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, operating and maintaining the Terrebonne Parish Health Unit and health unit facilities, title to which shall be in the public?

Race.SpecificTitle: Bayou Cane FPD Prop. #1 -- 20 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Bayou Cane Fire Protection District Propositions
Proposition No. 1
(Millage Renewal)

Summary:  10-year 20-mills property tax renewal for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, maintaining and operating said District's fire protection facilities and emergency medical services, vehicles and equipment, including both real and immovable property.
Race.FullText: Shall the Bayou Cane Fire Protection District of the Parish of Terrebonne, State of Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy a twenty (20) mills tax on all property subject to taxation in said District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2014 and ending with the year 2023, (an estimated $3,800,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, maintaining and operating said District's fire protection facilities and emergency medical services, vehicles and equipment, including both real and immovable property?

Race.SpecificTitle: Bayou Cane FPD Prop. #2 -- 10 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Bayou Cane Fire Protection District Propositions
Proposition No. 2
(Millage)

Summary:  10-year 10-mills property tax for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, maintaining and operating said District's fire protection facilities and emergency medical services, vehicles and equipment, including both real and immovable property.
Race.FullText: Shall the Bayou Cane Fire Protection District of the Parish of Terrebonne, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a ten (10) mills tax on all property subject to taxation in said District for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022, (an estimated $1,900,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year) for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, maintaining and operating said District's fire protection facilities and emergency medical services, vehicles and equipment, including both real and immovable property?

Race.SpecificTitle: Fire Prot. Dist. No. 4-A -- 5.71 Mills - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Fire Protection District No. 4-A Proposition  
(Millage Continuation)
 
Summary:  Authority for Fire Protection District No. 4-A to continue to levy a 10-year 5.71-mill property tax for constructing, maintaining and operating the District's fire protection and emergency medical service facilities, for purchasing fire trucks and other fire fighting or emergency medical service equipment and paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrant rentals and service.
Race.FullText: Shall Fire Protection District No. 4-A of the Parish of Terrebonne, State of Louisiana (the "District"), continue to levy and collect a special tax of five and seventy-one hundredths (5.71) mills on all property subject to taxation in said District, for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2014 and ending with the year 2023 (an estimated $340,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for the purpose of constructing, maintaining and operating the District's fire protection and emergency medical service facilities for purchasing fire trucks and other fire fighting or emergency medical service equipment and paying the cost of obtaining water for fire protection purposes, including charges for fire hydrant rentals and service, said millage to represent a fourteen hundredths (.14) mill increase over the 5.57 mills tax authorized to be levied through the year 2013 pursuant to an election held on March 9, 2004?
